com.sap.dirigible.repository.api

Interface IRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBRepository

    public interface IRepository
    This interface represents a repository. It allows for querying, modifying and navigating through collections and resources.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String SEPARATOR 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanupOldVersions()
      Clean-up the file versions older than a month For full fledged SCM system, use external e.g.
      ICollection createCollection(java.lang.String path)
      This method creates a new empty collection at the specified path.
      IResource createResource(java.lang.String path)
      This method creates a new empty resource at the specified path.
      IResource createResource(java.lang.String path, byte[] content)
      This method creates a new resource at the specified path and fills it with the specified content.
      IResource createResource(java.lang.String path, byte[] content, boolean isBinary, java.lang.String contentType)
      This method creates a new empty resource at the specified path.
      void dispose()
      Disposes of this repository.
      byte[] exportZip(java.util.List<java.lang.String> relativeRoots)
      Export all the content under the given path(s) with the target repository instance Include the last segment of the relative roots during the archiving
      byte[] exportZip(java.lang.String relativeRoot, boolean inclusive)
      Export all the content under the given path with the target repository instance Include or NOT the last segment of the relative root during the archiving
      ICollection getCollection(java.lang.String path)
      Returns an ICollection instance representing the resource at the specified path.
      IResource getResource(java.lang.String path)
      Returns an instance of IResource which represents the resource located at the specified path.
      IResourceVersion getResourceVersion(java.lang.String path, int version)
      Retrieve a particular version of a given resource
      java.util.List<IResourceVersion> getResourceVersions(java.lang.String path)
      Retrieve all the kept versions of a given resource
      ICollection getRoot()
      Returns an instance of ICollection which represents the root collection of the repository.
      boolean hasCollection(java.lang.String path)
      Returns whether a collection with the specified path exists in the repository.
      boolean hasResource(java.lang.String path)
      Returns whether a resource with the specified path exists in the repository.
      void importZip(byte[] data, java.lang.String relativeRoot)
      Imports content from zip file to the repository, based on the relative root
      void importZip(java.util.zip.ZipInputStream zipInputStream, java.lang.String relativeRoot)
      Imports content from zip file to the repository, based on the relative root
      void removeCollection(java.lang.String path)
      This method removes the collection with the specified path from the repository.
      void removeResource(java.lang.String path)
      This method removes the resource at the specified path from the repository.
      java.util.List<IEntity> searchName(java.lang.String parameter, boolean caseInsensitive)
      Search the given given parameter in the names of the files and folders ( means *parameter)
      java.util.List<IEntity> searchPath(java.lang.String parameter, boolean caseInsensitive)
      Search the given given parameter in the names of the files and folders (means *parameter*)
      java.util.List<IEntity> searchText(java.lang.String parameter, boolean caseInsensitive)
      Search the given given parameter in the names of the files and folders as well as in the content of the text files

    • Field Detail

      • SEPARATOR

        static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        ICollection getRoot()
        Returns an instance of ICollection which represents the root collection of the repository.

        This method does not throw any exceptions for convenience but is not guaranteed to return a valid collection. One should check this by using the ICollection#isValid() method.

      • createCollection

        ICollection createCollection(java.lang.String path)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new empty collection at the specified path.

        The returned value is an instance of ICollection which represents the newly created collection.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getCollection

        ICollection getCollection(java.lang.String path)
        Returns an ICollection instance representing the resource at the specified path.

        The collection may not exist at the specified path.

      • removeCollection

        void removeCollection(java.lang.String path)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method removes the collection with the specified path from the repository.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hasCollection

        boolean hasCollection(java.lang.String path)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns whether a collection with the specified path exists in the repository.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createResource

        IResource createResource(java.lang.String path)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new empty resource at the specified path.

        The returned value is an instance of IResource that represents the newly created resource.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createResource

        IResource createResource(java.lang.String path,
                       byte[] content)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new resource at the specified path and fills it with the specified content.

        The returned value is an instance of IResource that represents the newly created resource.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createResource

        IResource createResource(java.lang.String path,
                       byte[] content,
                       boolean isBinary,
                       java.lang.String contentType)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new empty resource at the specified path.

        The returned value is an instance of IResource that represents the newly created resource.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getResource

        IResource getResource(java.lang.String path)
        Returns an instance of IResource which represents the resource located at the specified path.

        The resource may not exist at the specified path.

      • removeResource

        void removeResource(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method removes the resource at the specified path from the repository.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hasResource

        boolean hasResource(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns whether a resource with the specified path exists in the repository.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Disposes of this repository.

        Calling this method allows for the repository to release all allocated resources.

        Calling this method more than once will be a no-op.

      • importZip

        void importZip(java.util.zip.ZipInputStream zipInputStream,
             java.lang.String relativeRoot)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Imports content from zip file to the repository, based on the relative root

        relativeRoot -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        void importZip(byte[] data,
             java.lang.String relativeRoot)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Imports content from zip file to the repository, based on the relative root
        Parameters:
        data - the Zip file as byte array
        relativeRoot -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportZip

        byte[] exportZip(java.util.List<java.lang.String> relativeRoots)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Export all the content under the given path(s) with the target repository instance Include the last segment of the relative roots during the archiving
        Parameters:
        relativeRoot -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportZip

        byte[] exportZip(java.lang.String relativeRoot,
               boolean inclusive)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Export all the content under the given path with the target repository instance Include or NOT the last segment of the relative root during the archiving
        Parameters:
        relativeRoot - single root
        inclusive - whether to include the last segment of the root or to pack its content directly in the archive
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
